topics.title: Cold open: LinkedIn feed turnaround and AI-first
topics.summary: Lenny tees up LinkedIn’s surprising feed transformation and asks what strategy drove it. Tomer frames LinkedIn’s potential as an economic opportunity platform and hints that making the feed AI-first was foundational.

topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Lenny introduces Tomer Cohen, his role as LinkedIn CPO, and the episode’s focus: revamping the feed, shifting to an AI-first mindset, and product leadership principles.

topics.title: Tomerism: “We might be wrong, not confused”
topics.summary: They unpack Tomer’s mantra as a leadership tool: prioritize clarity of thought and execution over being “right,” align teams on a single direction, and avoid hedging that creates organizational confusion.

topics.title: Clarity in practice: principles and resourcing
topics.summary: Tomer explains how to drive clarity via precise problem statements, first-principles solutions with real tradeoffs, and explicit disagreement. He also stresses clarity of execution: priorities must match resourcing and top talent allocation.

topics.title: Why clarity is liberating for teams
topics.summary: They discuss how making it okay to be wrong—but not okay to be unclear—reduces fear, improves learning loops, and prevents meetings that end without shared understanding of problems and next steps.

topics.title: Ambitious goals and “share the peak” vision
topics.summary: Tomer shares another leadership principle: set massive, inspiring goals and then over-deliver. He describes visualizing the “mountain peak” and working backward, even if the middle path is blurry.

topics.title: LinkedIn feed turnaround: purpose and AI engine
topics.summary: Tomer details the feed’s shift from promotional activity tracking to professional knowledge exchange. Key moves: redefine the feed’s purpose, make AI the “engine,” unify a previously centralized AI team with product goals, and manage internal dependencies in a turnaround.

topics.title: Carving out 2M users and choosing feed KPIs
topics.summary: They go deeper on the tactic of isolating a 2M-member cohort to iterate without destabilizing company-wide metrics, then scaling once proven. Tomer also explains focusing on downstream, high-value engagement rather than top-level sessions.

topics.title: Conviction-led product bets and thinking time
topics.summary: Tomer explains how he selects big opportunities by starting from beliefs and potential, not past failures or current numbers. He describes being reflective, optimistic, and using “vision to values” framing to imagine world-change outcomes.

topics.title: AI matchmaking for creators and consumers
topics.summary: Tomer argues the biggest tactical lever was AI as a marketplace matchmaker: getting creators’ posts to the right influential audiences and giving consumers relevant, actionable content. He shares examples of posts reaching key decision-makers and generating major economic opportunity.

topics.title: Operationalizing an AI-first mindset at LinkedIn
topics.summary: Tomer explains AI-first as a strategy and operating model: PMs must own algorithm objectives, features, data, fine-tuning, and even infrastructure. LinkedIn implemented an AI academy, review rigor, AI practitioners on product teams, and shifted portfolios after LLM breakthroughs.

topics.title: Letting go of control: AI as ingredients
topics.summary: Tomer describes a key mindset shift: product leaders stop fully dictating deterministic flows and instead define ingredients, constraints, and safety guardrails while AI generates experiences. They discuss avoiding “AI everywhere” mistakes by starting from user objectives, encouraging exploration, and learning through iteration.
